results.name: Least k such that A054353(k)>=n
comment: a(n)=1 plus the number of symbol changes in the first n terms of A000002. [From Jean-Marc Fedou and _Gabriele Fici_, Mar 18 2010]
Comment from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 12 2018 (Start)
This seems to be A001462 rewritten so the run lengths are given by A000002. The companion sequence, A000002 rewritten so the run lengths are given by A001462, is A321020.

Note that Kolakoski's sequence A000002 and Golomb's sequence A001462 have very similar definitions, although the asymptotic behavior of A001462 is well-understood, while that of A000002 is a mystery. The asymptotic behavior of the two hybrids A156253 and A321020 might be worth investigating. (End)
link: J.M. Fedou and G. Fici, Some remarks on differentiable sequences and recursivity, Journal of Integer Sequences 13(3): Article 10.3.2 (2010).

N. J. A. Sloane, Coordination Sequences, Planing Numbers, and Other Recent Sequences (II), Experimental Mathematics Seminar, Rutgers University, Jan 31 2019, Part I, Part 2, Slides. (Mentions this sequence)
formula: Conjecture: a(n) should be asymptotic to 2n/3.
Length of n-th run of the sequence = A000002(n) [From _Benoit Cloitre_, Feb 19 2009]
mathematica: a2 = {1, 2, 2}; Do[ a2 = Join[a2, {1 + Mod[n - 1, 2]}], {n, 3, 80}, {i, 1, a2[[n]]}]; a3 = Accumulate[a2]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = For[k = a[n - 1], True, k++, If[a3[[k]] >= n, Return[k]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 80}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 18 2013 *)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Feb 07 2009
